text: Pointed chin 90% Recurrent fractures 90% Scoliosis 90% Thick eyebrow 90% Abnormal form of the vertebral bodies 50% Abnormality of the ribs 50% Carious teeth 50% Clinodactyly of the 5th finger 50% Elbow dislocation 7.5% Seizures 7.5% The Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) has collected information on how often a sign or symptom occurs in a condition. Much of this information comes from Orphanet, a European rare disease database. The frequency of a sign or symptom is usually listed as a rough estimat
